result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Dismissed and Read-in to: 20CF575.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:59 AM Defendant Jessica L Neuhaus appeared by video, in custody (via West Allis Memorial).  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Jessica L Neuhaus.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court raises an issue related to charging language as it relates to element regarding employment status in criminal complaint. 
Counsel request a date next week to further investigate. Court sets. Defendant may appear by zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Letter dated 08/03/2022, filed by Atty Tapia, requesting an adjournment of the 08/18 Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   **Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/08/2022 - Approved.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:22 AM Defendant Jessica L Neuhaus in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Tapia is asking for a plea/sentencing date.  The Court will set this matter for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:29 PM Defendant Jessica L Neuhaus in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:15 am.
